1.brief: a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
a command, whether human or divine (collectively, the Law)
to hide (by covering over); by implication, to hoard or reserve; figuratively to deny; specifically (favorably) to protect, (unfavorably) to lurk
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.

2.brief: to prick up the ears, i.e. hearken
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
intelligence; by implication, an argument; by extension, caprice

used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not

intelligence; by implication, an argument; by extension, caprice
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)

to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
a secret storehouse; hence, a secreted valuable (buried); generally money
to seek; causatively, to conceal oneself (i.e. let be sought), or mask

to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
fear (also used as infinitive); morally, reverence

properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)

support or (by implication) ability, i.e. (direct) help, (in purpose) an undertaking, (intellectual) understanding
a shield (i.e. the small one or buckler); figuratively, a protector; also the scaly hide of the crocodile
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)

a well-trodden road (literally or figuratively); also a caravan

a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.

to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity

evenness, i.e. (figuratively) prosperity or concord; also straightness, i.e. (figuratively) rectitude (only in plural with singular sense; often adverbially)

a track (literally or figuratively); also a rampart (as circular)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)

strange, in a variety of degrees and applications (foreign, non-relative, adulterous, different, wonderful)

to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)

the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
